Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make sure all files are saved.
2. Do command "Save All"
3. Error message "Command 'Files: Save All' is not enabled in the current context."

It is unclear as to what this means. As all files are already saved either no message should appear or the message should state that all files are already saved or there are no files to save to something like that. The existing information message doesn't provide useful information.

data.title: Syntax highlighting bug with string interpolation in javascript?
data.body:
This "might" be a "minor" bug in the syntax highlighting engine of VSCode. It doesn't appear to be recognizing string interpolation. I tried to use "Javascript" & "JavaScript React" language modes.

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.11

Steps to Reproduce:

Pretty self evident how to reproduce :). Here is a screenshot:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1213549/21933084/871d2be6-d969-11e6-8e46-65e23dcbd8db.png)

As you can see it thinks the entire thing is a string.

data.title: Malwarebytes doubles VS Code startup time

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hey, I was going to report an issue with a slower VS Code recently, but then I found the cause & am reporting it to you.

Basically, I recently noticed that startup time went up from ~2-3 seconds to ~6-7 seconds. More annoyingly, I usually start VS Code by searching for it in Start Menu & pressing Enter or left click. However, VS Code turned into the one application that upon starting from Start Menu would freeze the Start Menu for another 1-2 seconds. Normally, Start Menu closes instantly, and VS Code was the one app causing such odd behavior.

After playing around, I tracked down the issue - I recently installed [Malwarebytes ](https://www.malwarebytes.com/premium/) and keep it running in the background. Whilst it is turned on, VS Code is much slower. When I turn Malwarebytes off, VS Code returns to starting very quickly & Start Menu closing instantly,

I wonder if reporting this symptom could be useful to you & if something could be done about it in some future version (unless it's just me :) ) .

data.title: Add line per line in Git panel
data.body:
It would be nice to have an equivalent of `git add -p`.

For example when looking at a file diff, on the left, close to line number have a `+` symbol to add only that line in staging.

data.title: Tooling stops working after VSCode update
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:42:49.304Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.0.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|elm-format|abadi199|0.1.0|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.51|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|elm|sbrink|0.8.3|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|1.0.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Update VSCode
2. Go tooling such as Goimports and Gofmt seem to stop working

I would suggest this can't be reliably reproduced, but I've seen this behaviour on a couple of updates.  Preferences are not changed.  On the last occasion even restarting did not help. 

I should say that the issue seems temporary. In that the tooling does eventually work again without action on my part. I'm wondering if the plugins that provide the tooling mentioned take time to update.

data.title: Need support to specify cwd per terminal instance
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0

The task framework supports to specify a cwd per task (e.g command). To support this when running tasks in a terminal I need API to set the cwd per created terminal instance.

data.title: debug hover failed when using chrome debugger
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (2cdc2b3da8f0fd5322b48747241584cf9dd98f8f, 2017-01-13T07:09:47.827Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.4.2|
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create `index.js`
```
function fuck() {
    var error;
    console.log(error.fuck);
}
fuck();
```

2. create `index.html`
```
<!DOCTYPE HTML>
<html>
<head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <title>Test</title>
	<script src="./index.js"></script>
</head>
</html>
```

3. create `.vscode/launch.json`

```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch Chrome against localhost",
            "type": "chrome",
            "request": "launch",
            "file": "${workspaceRoot}/index.html",
            "webRoot": "${workspaceRoot}"
        }
    ]
}
```

4. Launch chrome debugger. the debugger will paused in exception. 

5. Hover the text `fuck`.

6. Toggle VSCode DevTools will find the error log.

```
Cannot read property 'startLineNumber' of null: TypeError: Cannot read property 'startLineNumber' of null
    at Function.e.containsRange (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:40:10005)
    at file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:101:6764
    at Array.filter (native)
    at file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:101:6730
    at then (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:32:17375)
    at e.findExpressionInStackFrame (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:101:6658)
```

---

The reason for this bug is https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/524150b9f9ab4ce0cb00e8972f00511c9a8749d9 to fix https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16632

I add a comment for the commit.

data.title: Words Should by Split by Em Dash and En Dash

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9-insiders

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enable `"editor.wordBasedSuggestions": true`
2. Create a text file that uses an em-dash:
```md
abc‚Äîxyz
```
3. Trigger completion on next line

**Expected Behavior**
Entries for `abc` and `xyz` show as suggestions separately.

**Actual Behavior**
An entry for `abc‚Äîxyz` is shown

![screen shot 2017-01-12 at 10 23 25 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/212305/21920413/c5b113b2-d915-11e6-9708-d04af67673da.png)


We actually split words using hypens, but not for en-dashes or em-dashes.

```md
hy-pen
en‚Äìdash
em‚Äîdash
```

![screen shot 2017-01-12 at 10 25 00 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/212305/21920450/f8e56b8e-d915-11e6-8d04-4aac0ddeed70.png)

 
If anything, this behavior is the opposite of what I expect.

data.title: Fix build
cannot fold namespaces in c++ files
toggleSuggestionDetails when there is no jsdoc
data.body:
From this question: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41614733/see-the-entire-information-of-intellisense

I can use ctrl+space in the intellisense window for toggleSuggestionDetails when something has JSDoc, but otherwise, I can't see the full untruncated details.

- Add this code to any TS file:
```
declare var FooBar: {
	new(): typeof FooBar;
	prototype: ErrorEvent;
	bar(): any;
}
```

- Type `FooBar` and trigger intellisense
- See that there is cut off text, describing the type of FooBar, and ending in ... like in the SO question, but no way to see the full text.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/21918538/19e997e2-d907-11e6-9061-3d5cbbd01ffd.png)


- Add a jsdoc-style to the thing, like

```
/**
 * foo
 */
```

- Now when you repeat the steps to see intellisense, you can press ctrl+space again to see a large popup with the full text

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/21918542/25ff259c-d907-11e6-95d2-d328cff78284.png)

Should this be available in every case? Maybe it's not because we don't know whether the text is cut off.

data.title: Fix webview internal  links
data.body:
Fixes #18486

**bug**
Click on an internal link in an extension readme. This opens `webview.html` in the editor

**Fix**
In Webview-pre, If the link being clicked has an href value (not the resolved href) equal to it's hash value, treat it as an internal link and scroll to it

The root cause of this issue is that extension readmes do not set a `baseUrl` on the webview. This change ensures that even if `baseUrl` is not set, we do the correct thing for internal links
